text: Peru competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Open water swimming== Peru qualified one female open water swimmer. {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|María Bramont-Arias |align=left|Women's 5 km |58:09.1 |10 |-align=center |align=left|Women's 10 km |1:55:33.8 |26 |} ==Swimming== Peru entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Gustavo Gutierrez |align=left|200 m butterfly |2:01.64 |36 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m individual medley |4:33.87 |36 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Christian Mayer |align=left|400 m freestyle |4:05.33 |42 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m individual medley |2:09.69 |44 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left|McKenna de Bever |align=left|200 m individual medley |2:16.97 |25 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Maria Fé Muñoz |align=left|200 m butterfly |2:15.28 |27 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m individual medley |4:58.62 |24 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==References== World Aquatics Championship Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships 2019
title: Peru at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
